physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination revealed a mild effusion. Range of motion was painful and severely limited, with flexion to 80° and a 45° extension loss. Forearm rotation was also painful and mildly limited. No neurologic deficits were noted.
At the end of the procedure, flexion was 140° and loss of extension was 10°.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After surgery, the patient's range of motion showed improvement with post-operative flexion of 135°, loss of extension of 30° at six months follow-up.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Fibrinogen levels ranged from a minimum of 0.3 g/L and a peak at a maximum of 1.4 g/L during this period.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Range of motion plateaued with flexion of 135°, loss of extension of 30°, and full forearm rotation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At one and two years follow-up, the range of motion remained unchanged compared with six months follow-up.
